newsitem.title: USA: China bank files with SEC for $300 mln in notes.
newsitem.headline: China bank files with SEC for $300 mln in notes.

text.p: The State Development Bank of China said Wednesday it filed a registration with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $300 million in notes.
The offering will be made through Lehman Brothers, J.P. Morgan & Co, Credit Suisse First Boston, Morgan Stanley & Co Inc, Smith Barney Inc and BancAmerica Securities Inc.
The filing did not disclose when the notes will be due. The fiscal agent for the notes will be Chase Manhattan Bank.

Proceeds from sale of the notes will be used to fund dollar-denominated loans extended by the Bank to finance construction projects in China which require foreign currency to buy goods and services from non-Chinese suppliers.
The bank fosters economic development in China through long-term financing for projects under the state's development plan and industrial policies.
